item.title: 据说中国数据中心运营商悠活将考虑在美国上市
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，在中国数据中心运营商尝试在中国大陆上市失败多年后，Yovole 正在考虑在美国进行首次公开募股。【原文：Yovole is considering an initial public offering in the US, people familiar with the matter said, years after the Chinese data center operator’s failed attempt to list in mainland China.】

item.title: 欧洲银行股从 2020 年以来最繁忙的一年中获得提振
item.description: 自 2020 年以来，欧洲银行吸引了最多的并购交易，这股交易热潮推动了这些银行的股价表现超越同行，并有望延续到明年。【原文：European banks have attracted the most M&A since 2020 in a flurry of dealmaking that has powered peer-beating performance in their stocks and looks set to spill over into next year.】

item.title: CATL 推出机箱，称可抵御碰撞起火
item.description: 当代安培力士科技有限公司（Amperex Technology Co.Ltd. 推出了一种新型汽车底盘，其集成电池足以抵御高冲击力碰撞造成的火灾或爆炸。【原文：Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. unveiled a new car chassis with an integrated battery strong enough to withstand fires or explosions from high-impact collisions.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市有望在较短交易日内上涨
泰国内阁批准 2025 年保持 1%-3%的通胀目标
item.description: 泰国内阁批准了一项在 2025 年保持官方通胀目标不变的协议，这是泰国央行在抵制了要求提高目标的呼声后取得的胜利，因为提高目标将为更多的降息铺平道路。【原文：Thailand’s cabinet endorsed a deal to keep the official inflation target unchanged in 2025, a victory for the Bank of Thailand after it resisted calls for a higher goal that would have paved the way for more rate cuts.】

item.title: 路透社称中国计划发行创纪录的 4,110 亿美元特别债券
item.description: 据路透社周二报道，中国决策者计划在2025年出售创纪录的3万亿元人民币（合4110亿美元）特别国债，以提振正在放缓的经济。【原文：China’s policymakers plan to sell a record 3 trillion yuan ($411 billion) of special treasury bonds in 2025, Reuters reported Tuesday, as the government seeks to boost the slowing economy.】

item.title: 与日元挂钩的美国债券收益率自 2022 年以来首次出现正值
item.description: 由于美联储降息，日本投资者的货币对冲国债收益率两年多来首次升至零以上。【原文：Currency-hedged Treasury yields for Japanese investors have risen above zero for the first time in more than two years as the Federal Reserve cut interest rates.】

item.title: 特使称在核能领域坚持美国立场将使波兰受益
item.description: 即将离任的华沙特使说，波兰政府正在为其新生的民用核能项目规划第二选址，因此波兰应坚持与美国公司合作。【原文：Poland should stick with US companies as the government plans a second location for its nascent civil nuclear energy program, the outgoing envoy to Warsaw said.】

item.title: 中国财政部承诺在 2025 年加大、加快支出力度
item.description: 中国财政部重申，明年将增加公共开支，更加注重促进消费，以支持经济发展，应对美国关税威胁带来的增长阻力。【原文：China’s finance ministry reaffirmed it will increase public spending with a greater focus on boosting consumption to support the economy next year, ahead of growth headwinds from looming US tariffs.】

item.title: 财富管理费上涨，星展股价43%的涨势有望延续
item.description: 星展集团控股有限公司（DBS Group Holdings Ltd.）的股价将结束自2009年以来表现最好的一年，一些分析师预测，在该行蓬勃发展的财富管理业务的推动下，这一涨势可能会延续下去。【原文：DBS Group Holdings Ltd.’s shares are set to close out their best year since 2009, with some analysts predicting the rally could extend, driven by the bank’s burgeoning wealth management business.】

item.title: 发现工人处于 "奴隶 "环境后，巴西叫停比亚迪工厂
item.description: 巴西当局停止了一家新电动汽车工厂的建设，因为发现该工厂的工人在类似 "奴隶 "的条件下工作和生活，比亚迪公司因此与一家建筑公司断绝了关系。【原文：BYD Co. has severed ties with a construction firm after Brazilian authorities halted construction of a new electric-vehicle plant where workers were found working and living in “slavery”-like conditions.】

item.title: 铁矿石跌破 100 美元，中国房地产困境将进一步恶化
item.description: 铁矿石跌破每吨 100 美元，因为市场对中国房地产业的前景进行了权衡，预计中国房地产业将会恶化。【原文：Iron ore dropped below $100 a ton as the market weighed the outlook for China’s property sector, which is expected to worsen.】

item.title: 回购缓解对日产交易的担忧，本田股价大涨 17
item.description: 本田汽车公司（Honda Motor Co., Ltd.）的股价攀升超过 17%，创下 8 月份以来的最大涨幅，此前这家汽车制造商表示，将在明年 12 月之前回购高达 1.1 万亿日元（约合 70 亿美元）的股票，以达成一项相当于收购陷入困境的同行日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor Co., Ltd.）的交易。【原文：Honda Motor Co.’s shares climbed over 17%, the most since August, after the carmaker said it would repurchase up to ¥1.1 trillion ($7 billion) in shares by next December, ahead of a deal that amounts to an acquisition of ailing peer Nissan Motor Co.】

item.title: 提醒印度投资者注意小盘股的隐藏风险
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 世茂降低香港第二大酒店要价
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，违约的中国开发商世茂集团控股有限公司已将香港机场附近一家喜来登品牌酒店的要价降低了四分之一。【原文：Defaulted Chinese developer Shimao Group Holdings Ltd. has slashed the asking price for a Sheraton-branded hotel property near Hong Kong’s airport by a quarter, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日本对货币过度波动发出更多警告
item.description: 由于日元持续疲软，日本财政大臣周二警告说，如果日元出现过度波动，日本将采取行动。【原文：Japan will take action if there are excessive movements in the yen, its finance minister warned Tuesday as weakness in the currency continues.】

item.title: 台积电股价触及历史新高，期待人工智能带来 1999 年以来最好的一年
item.description: 台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. shares touched a record high, as the world’s largest contract chipmaker is poised to cap its best annual stock performance in 25 years.】

item.title: 交易员关注 2025 年不确定的加息路径，黄金维持跌势
item.description: 由于交易商权衡了美联储明年减息步伐放缓的前景，黄金维持跌势。【原文：Gold held a decline as traders weighed the prospect for a slower pace of interest-rate cuts by the Federal Reserve next year.】

item.title: 比特币势头减弱，进入创纪录一年的最后冲刺阶段
item.description: 比特币在创纪录的一年的最后阶段表现不佳。【原文：Bitcoin is flagging in the last leg of a record-breaking year.】

item.title: 北卡罗来纳州亚马逊工人申请参加工会选举
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. 北卡罗来纳州一家仓库的员工向全国劳资关系委员会提交了一份请愿书，要求举行一次选举，以决定该仓库的工人是否将由工会代表。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. employees at a North Carolina warehouse filed a petition with the National Labor Relations Board requesting an election to determine if workers in the facility will be represented by a union.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行对 CPI 更有信心，但现在宣布胜利还为时过早
item.description: 澳大利亚中央银行 12 月份的会议纪要显示，该行对通胀持续向目标迈进更有信心，但鉴于近期消费回升和劳动力市场依然紧张，现在就断定这场战役已经胜利还为时过早。【原文：Australia’s central bank is more confident that inflation is moving sustainably toward target but it’s still too soon to conclude the battle is won given a recent pick-up in consumption and a still-tight labor market, minutes of the December meeting showed.】

item.title: 日本 2024 年股市上涨带来的美元回报微不足道
item.description: 日本股市在 2024 年取得了辉煌的业绩，但对于以美元为基础的投资者来说，情况却有所不同。【原文：Japanese stocks have had a banner year in 2024 but for dollar-based investors, it has been a different story.】

item.title: 中国市场狂飙突进，香港衍生品年内再创新高
item.description: 香港的衍生产品交易连续第三年创下新高。【原文：For a third year in a row, trading of derivatives in Hong Kong has hit a record.】

item.title: 高盛认为日元正处于全球日股买家的有利位置
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The yen’s current level versus the dollar is positive for overseas investors to buy Japanese stocks, said Bruce Kirk, chief Japan equity strategist at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 加息在即，日本初创企业将迎来有史以来最长的衰退期
item.description: 日本初创企业股票的一项指标将创下有史以来最长的年度跌幅记录，原因是利率上调的威胁使一些投资者对该行业望而却步。【原文：A gauge of Japan’s startup stocks is headed for its longest run of annual losses on record as the threat of higher interest rates adds to a list of issues keeping some investors away from the sector.】

item.title: 2025 年中国房地产股反弹面临现实考验
item.description: 中国房地产的困境似乎将在好转之前变得更加严重，尽管最近有所反弹，但房地产股今年的前景依然悲惨。【原文：China’s real estate woes look set to get worse before they get better, raising the prospect of a miserable year for property shares despite a recent bounce.】

item.title: 华尔街科技股走强，亚洲股市有望上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在全球最大的几家科技公司反弹提振美国基准指数之后，亚洲股市将继续走高。【原文：Stocks in Asia are set to edge higher after a rally in some of the world’s largest technology companies lifted US benchmarks.】

item.title: 墨西哥以涉嫌倾销为由对越南钢丝征收 36% 的关税
item.description: 墨西哥将对从越南进口的焊接用钢丝征收 36.23% 的关税，称这损害了拉丁美洲第二大经济体的本地生产商。【原文：Mexico will impose a 36.23% tariff on imports of steel wire used for welding from Vietnam, saying they are harming local producers in Latin America’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 名人支持的美甲沙龙 Glosslab 申请破产
item.description: Glosslab LLC 是一家总部位于纽约的美甲连锁店，曾尝试过会员制商业模式，并吸引了不少名人投资者，现已申请破产。【原文：Glosslab LLC, a New York City-based nail salon chain that experimented with a membership-based business model and attracted celebrity investors, has filed bankruptcy.】

item.title: 法国政府希望 2025 年赤字率保持在国内生产总值的 5%左右或更高一点
item.description: 法国总理弗朗索瓦-巴伊鲁说，他的目标是与议会就2025年预算达成协议，将国家赤字降至接近5%的水平，接近他的前任曾试图达到但未果的水平。【原文：French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou said he aimed to reach an agreement with parliament on a 2025 budget that would reduce the country’s deficit to close to 5%, near the level that his predecessor unsuccessfully tried to reach.】
